post_title: What to do early morning as a tourist?

comments.author: a2800276
comments.body: If your plane arrives at 7, you won't be in town before 8. Go to you hotel and drop off luggage. Cafe Richard is in the immediate vicinity of the Dom and you could start there with a nice breakfast. The Dom itself is open early so you can check that out before or after breakfast. Most other museums open around 10. If your hotel is a bit more out of the way, drop your luggage at the main station, it's also immediately by the Dom.

comments.author: Last-Cancel9073
comments.body: Many bakeries are open early in the morning. You can have breakfast there

comments.author: potatofriend26
comments.body: What day of the week will you arrive?

comments.author: Friendly-Horror-777
comments.body: Have a breakfast-Kölsch in a pub that's still open from the night before.

comments.author: daydreamersrest
comments.body: You could check out Cafe Extrablatt (there are several in the city), they offer buffet style breakfast every day of the week. Other than that, yes, there are nice museums all around, mostly art and history related.

comments.author: Independent-Heart-74
comments.body: Tuesday. Our planned activities start from Wednesday due to the long travel hours

comments.author: Independent-Heart-74
comments.body: We will - we try to avoid places that are too crowded. Most of our destinations are the nature reserves for some photography and historic buildings

comments.author: Arakius
comments.body: Please don't. Extrablatt is German Olive Garden

comments.author: Acceptable_Support42
comments.body: Yes, Extrablatt is generic chain but it’s a perfectly fine place to just chill. They have a large menu and large locations(usually) so you won’t be waiting long for a table

comments.author: potatofriend26
comments.body:
Plenty of museums open at 10 am. Wallraf, Roman-Germanic, NS-Dokumentationszentrum just to name a few.

Until then you could look for bakeries, they open pretty early. I like épi

comments.author: Independent-Heart-74
comments.body: Thank you, that would be a nice way to spend the day

comments.author: Blaueveilchen
comments.body: The Roman-Germanic museum is very good and interesting. It is very near the cathedrale of Cologne. Opposite of this museum is a well known local pub. The museum is also near all types of shops.

comments.author: SpecialCarry7485
comments.body: The museum was moved to the house of Belgium due to renovations to the Roman-Germanic museum, at least as of late November that was the case

comments.author: siesta1412
comments.body: The RGM is currently closed due to renovations.
